title: Lehigh Valley haunted houses and Halloween attractions
text:
Halloween is well under way in the Lehigh Valley, with fun and games for the both the daring and the timid. The favorites are back for 2015 and two regional attractions — Bates Motel and Terror Behind the Walls — are celebrating 25 years of frightful fun.
There are new attractions at Dorney's Halloween Haunt. And Shocktoberfest will keep the season going into November, because there's a Friday the 13th lurking there.
Here is your complete guide to haunted houses and other Halloween attractions around the Lehigh Valley area. Click here to see area trick or treat times and Halloween parades .
Three ghosts: Not recommended for children 11 and under
Barn of Horrors and Terror Trail: Sinister apparitions roam the grounds haunting the barn and the trail. 7-10 p.m. Fri.-Sat.; 7-9 p.m. Sun. Through Oct. 31. Veterans of Foreign Wars, Water and Jefferson streets, Womelsdorf, $10, barn or trail; $15, combo, barnofhorrors.com.
Lehigh Valley trick or treat times and Halloween parades Deb Schnecker When is trick or treat in the Lehigh Valley? Here is a complete list of trick or treat times and Halloween parades for towns around the Lehigh Valley area for 2015.
Click here to see a list of haunted houses and other Halloween attractions and events .
Alburtis: 6-8 p.m. Oct. 31.
Allentown: 6-8 p.m....
When is trick or treat in the Lehigh Valley? Here is a complete list of trick or treat times and Halloween parades for towns around the Lehigh Valley area for 2015.
Click here to see a list of haunted houses and other Halloween attractions and events .
Alburtis: 6-8 p.m. Oct. 31.
Allentown: 6-8 p.m....
(Deb Schnecker) Bates Motel and Haunted Hayride: Check into the motel, slip past scarecrows, zombies and other evil in the Haunted Corn Maze or try your luck on the Haunted Hayride, upgraded for the 25th anniversary, with the return of the Headless Horseman. 6:30-9:30 p.m. Sun.-Wed.; 6:30-10:30 p.m. Fri.-Sat. Through Nov. 1. Bates Motel, 1835 Middletown Road (Route 352), Glenn Mills, $15-$100, 610-459-0647, thebatesmotel.com.
Brinton Lodge Haunted House: "Horror in Free Love Valley": Re-creation of a true-life haunting. Fri.-Sat. Through Oct. 31. Brinton Lodge, 1808 W. Schuylkill Road, Douglassville, $22, 610-572-7121, brintonlodge.com/events.
Matt Blum/Special to The Morning Call Melissa Najarian, winner of the 2015 Miss Freak Out Pageant, gets up close and personal with her friend, Jack-O'-Lantern.
Melissa Najarian, winner of the 2015 Miss Freak Out Pageant, gets up close and personal with her friend, Jack-O'-Lantern.
(Matt Blum/Special to The Morning Call) Field of Screams: Frightmare Asylum, Den of Darkness, Haunted Hayride and Nocturnal Wasteland, live bands and other events, including rap battle competition, hip-hop dance battle competition. Hours vary. Through Nov. 13. Field of Screams, 3493 Marietta Ave., Lancaster, $18-$34, 717-285-7748, fieldofscreams.com.
Fright Factory: 25,000-square-foot-high haunted house in a 105-year-old building in South Philadelphia. 7:30-11 p.m. Fri.-Sat.; 7:30-10 p.m. Sun. and Oct. 29. Through Oct. 31. Fright Factory, 2200 S. Swanson St., Philadelphia, $13-$34, frightfactory.tv
Frightfest: 200 acres includes Hair Raising Hayride that drops you off in the middle of nowhere for a Treacherous Trek through the Trail of Terror; the only way back is through the MassAcre Maize, to the final nightmare, the Carnival of Chaos. 7-10 p.m. Fri.-Sat.; 7-9 p.m. Sun. Through Oct. 31. Schaefers Farm, 1051 County Route 523, Flemington, $30, 908-782-2705, schaefersfrightfest.com.
Fright Fest: Seasonal rides, scare zones, terror trails and haunted mazes plus zombies and Halloween-themed shows and attractions. 5:30 p.m.-midnight Fri.; 11 a.m.-midnight Sat.; 11 a.m.-11 p.m. Sun.; 11 a.m.-10 p.m. Oct. 12. Through Nov. 1. Six Flags Great Adventure, Route 537, Jackson, $69.99; $42.99, www.sixflags.com/greatadventure .
Halloween Haunt: Blackout, Chamber of Horrors, The Asylum, CarnEVIL, Desolation, Corn Stalkers, Age of Darkness, Mansion House Hotel, Cut Throat Island, Grave Walkers, Skeleton Crew and Blood Drum shows, rides, more. New is Trick or Treat, in which guests venture into the home of a witch looking to regain her youth through her unsuspecting visitors. 6 p.m-midnight Fri.;7 p.m.-midnight Sat. and Oct. 11. Through Oct. 30. Dorney Park, 3830 Dorney Park Road, South Whitehall Township, $25-$39, 610-395-2000, dorneypark.com.
Haunted House in the Hollow: House in the Hollow, Sleepy Hollow Hayride and Field of Fright, entertainment and refreshments by the bonfire. 7-10 p.m. Fri.-Sat.; 7-9 p.m. Sun. and Oct. 29. Through Oct. 31. Sleepy Hollow, 881 Highland Road, Newtown, $12-$35, 215-860-6855, sleepyhollowhayride.com.
Haunted Mill Scream Park: Haunted Mill, Maw's Crazy Maze, House of Eyes, Terror Trail. 6-11 p.m. Fri.-Sat.; 6-10 p.m. Sun. Through Nov. 1. Colonial Valley Scream Park, 5932 Colonial Valley Road, Spring Garden, 17362, $10-$50, kimskrypt.com
Haunted Village: 10 acres of haunted terrain, including the haunted mill, a maze, a spinning hallway known as the Vortex, a terror trail, and a haunted hay ride. 7 p.m. Oct. 9-10, Oct.16-17, Oct. 23-24. Red Mill Museum Village, 56 Main St., Clinton, N.J. $30; $45, Xpress Pass, 908-735-4101, redmillhauntedvillage.com.
Hotel of Horror and Altered Nightmares: "Spirit Sacrifice" at the Lake House Hotel and "Puppet Pandemonium" at Altered Nightmares. New: The Coffin Coach. 7-11 p.m. Fri.; 6-11 p.m. Sat. Through Oct, 31. Lakehouse Hotel, Route 115 & Cherry Valley Road, Saylorsburg, $5-$30 www.hotelofhorror.com
HorrorFest: Hayride of Horror, Barn of Horror, 3-D Alien Encounter, Carnage. 6-10 p.m. Fri.-Sat.; 6-9 p.m. Sun. Through Oct. 31. Shady Brook Farm, 931 Stony Hill Road, Morrisville, $20-$50, 215-968-1670, shadybrookfarm.com/horrorfest.
Jason's Woods: Horrifying Hayride, Zombie Apocalypse, Chamber of Horrors, Lost in Jason's Woods, Carnival of Fear, Fields of Fright and the Grand Jason's Woods Theater. Also, live music, theatrical shows, inflatable rides, laser tag, paintball, new Psycho Circus 3D attraction. 7-10 p.m. Fri.-Sat.; 7-9 p.m. Sun. Through Nov. 7. Jason's Woods, 90 Stehman Road, Lancaster, $25, three attractions; $40, six attractions, 717-875-5110, jasonswoods.com.
Lehigh Valley Zombie Paintball Hayride: Board a special forces zombie destroyer vehicle equipped with semi automatic assault rifles (paintball guns) and shoot and destroy all infected zombies. Also barnyard with walk through haunts, food vendors and campfire ($6). 6:30-9:30 p.m. Oct. 9-10; 6-9:30 p.m. Thurs.. Oct. 15-29; 6-10 p.m. Fri.-Sat., Oct. 16-31. Lehigh Valley Zombies, 7209 Kernsville Road, Orefield; Paintball ride: $20; $22, includes barnyard activities, lehighvalleyzombies.com.
Reapers Revenge: Haunted Hayride, Lost Carnival, Pitch Black, Sector 13. 6-11 p.m. Fri.-Sat.; 6-10 p.m. Sun. Through Nov. 1. Reaper's Revenge Haunted Hayride, 456 Swika Lane, Scott Township, $35, 570-253-4746, reapersrevenge.net.
Shocktoberfest: New: Zombie Safari Hayride Tour, Unknown 2.0 and Prison of the Dead Escape. Also Zombie Revenge Hayride, Zombie Paintball Hayride, Zombie Night Run, Prison of the Dead, Zombie Mud Run. 4:30-10 p.m. Fri.-Sat. Through Nov. 14; 4:30-9 p.m. Sun. Oct. 11-Nov. 1 and Oct. 22 and 29. Shocktoberfest, Park Avenue, Sinking Spring, $20-$60, 610-375-7273, shocktoberfest.com.
Terror Behind the Walls: 25th year of America's largest haunted house. Features six terrifying attractions inside the crumbling cellblocks of a real prison. New: Quarantine: 4D and Break Out! 7-11 p.m. Tues.-Thurs. and Oct. 26; 7 p.m.-midnight Fridays and Sundays; 6:30 p.m.-12:30 a.m. Sat. Through Nov. 7. Eastern State Penitentiary, 22nd Street and Fairmount Avenue, Philadelphia, $13-$39, 215-236-5111, easternstate.org.
The Freak and Funhouse: Horror, gore and freaks. 7-11 p.m. Saturdays, Through Oct. 31. Freak and Fun House, 422 White St., Bowmanstown, $12, 484-629-5428, thefreakandfunhouse.com.
The Haunting at the Waldorf Hotel: Waldorf Hotel, Haunted Hayride and Infection. 7-11 p.m. Fri,-Sat. Through Oct. 31. Country Junction, Route 209, Lehighton, $15-$35, 610-377-8447, countryjunction.com/#!waldorf-estate-of-fear/c3lv.
Valley of Fear and the Original Haunted Hayride: Haunted hayride, Scary Tales (haunted forest walk), Zombie Escape Maze, Operation Z (zombie paintball hunt). 6:45-9:30 p.m. Thurs.-Sun. also Oct. 28. Through Nov. 1. Phoenix Sport Club, 301 W. Bristol Road, $15-$45, 215-942-9787, valleyoffear.com.
Two ghosts: Use discretion with children 11 and younger
Death and Dying Cemetery Tour: Walk through the 1741 Gemeinhaus, a National Historic Landmark as well as the oldest standing building in the city; see an original 18th century dead tray, then stroll through God's Acre, Bethlehem's oldest cemetery, and hear stories of the men and women who once lived in town. 6 p.m. Thurs.-Fri.; 4:30 p.m. Sat.-Sun. Through Nov. 1. Moravian Museum, 66 W. Church St., Bethlehem, $12; $6, ages 4-12; free, ages 3 and under, 610-882-0450, historicbethlehem.org.
Ghost and Goblins Tour: Family tour through two crystal caverns, one haunted and one natural, followed by a family hayride (11 a.m.-5 p.m. Saturdays). Scary haunted caverns plus haunted trail and hayride (6-9:30 p.m. Fridays and Saturdays). Through Oct. 31. Lincoln Caverns and Whisper Rocks, 7703 William Penn Highway, Huntingdon, $19-98-$11.48. 814-643-0268, lincolncaverns.com.
Ghost Tour of New Hope: Lantern-led walk; learn about the doings on the towpath, or see the phantom hitchhiker or the historic inn where Aaron Burr appears from time to time. 8 p.m. Fri.-Sat. Through Oct. 31. New Hope, Bridge and Main streets, $10, 215-242-5564, ghosttoursofnewhope.com.
Halloween Ghost Lantern Tours: Ghost stories, folklore and history of haunted Crystal Cave by lantern light. 5:30 p.m. Oct. 10, 16-17, 23- 24, 30. Crystal Cave, 963 Crystal Cave Road, Kutztown, $20; $12, ages 8-11, 610-683-6765, crystalcavepa.com.
Haunted Hayride in the Parkway: Benefits Whitehall Township Fire Department. 7-11 p.m. Fri.-Sat. Through Oct. 31. Whitehall Parkway Recreational Area, South Church Street, $10; $3, ages 12-6; free, ages 5 and under, whitehalltownshipfire.org.
Haunted Hayride: Almost a mile of dark and twisting trails of terror to benefit the fire company. 7-10 p.m. Oct. 16-17, 23-24. Tylersport Volunteer Fire Company, 125 Ridge Road, $10; free, ages 4 and under. 215-257-5900.
Haunted Lantern Tours: Prowl the 19th century streets of Eckley encountering funny, scary, chilling and entertaining scenes of Halloween spirit. 6-10 p.m. Oct. 16-17, 23-24. First tour leaves at 6:30 p.m. Eckley Miners Village Museum, Two Eckley Main St., Weatherly, $10; $5, ages 6-12. 570- 636-2070, .
Haunted Woods: Guided walking tour in the backwoods of Zionsville. 6:30-10 p.m. Saturdays Through Oct. 31. Haunted Woods, 7125 Carls Hill Road, Zionsville, $7, hauntedwoodszionsville.com.
Historic Haunts of Downtown Bethlehem: Candlelight walking tour. Visit the paranormal, the mystic and the macabre and relive the stories of ghost soldiers at Moravian College, the legend of Liesel and Lafayette and many more. 5:45 p.m. Fri.-Sat. Through Oct. 31. Midnight tours Oct. 30-31. Moravian Book Shop, 428 Main St., Bethlehem, $13; $10, ages 12 and under, 610-866-5481, moravianbookshop.com.
Old Jail Ghost Tour: Take a tour of the jail and hear tales of ghostly encounters. 6:15-9 p.m. Oct. 10, 17. Old Jail Museum, 128 W. Broadway, Jim Thorpe, $10; $7, high school students, 570-325-5259, theoldjailmuseum.com.
Rotary Historic Ghost Walks in Old Mauch Chunk: Accompany your Ghost Guide on a one-mile outdoor walk on Broadway, with tales of ghoulish encounters. Reservations recommended. 7 and 8:30 p.m. Fridays, Oct. 9-30 and Nov. 7, Dec. 5 and 12; 7:15, 8:30 and 8:45 p.m. Saturdays, Oct. 7-31; 7 p.m. Sundays. Oct. 11- Nov. 1; 8 p.m. Fridays, Nov. 6-Dec. 4-18; 7 p.m. Saturdays, Nov. 14-28 and Dec. 19. The Inn at Jim Thorpe, 24 Broadway, $12; $6, ages 7-12, 570-325-2599, jimthorperotary.org/ghostwalks.cfm.
Toast with a Ghost! A Spirited Ghost Tour: "Trick or Treat" your way from Ridgewood Winery to Brinton Lodge's Hidden River Brewery, with treats of handcrafted wine and beer, and tales of the spirits that linger in the shadows of these historic sites. 3-6 p.m. Sundays Through Nov. 1.Brinton Lodge, 1808 W. Schuylkill Road, Douglassville, $25 (ages 13 and over only,) 610-572-7121, brintonlodge.com/events.
One ghost: For all ages; family friendly
Corn Cob Acres: 40 activities including train ride, Farm Animal Barrel, Cow Belly Bounces, Bat Cave and Spider Web Weave, pedal karts, giant sling shots, Jack-o'-lantern bean bag toss, more. 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Sat.; 11 a.m.-5 p.m. Sun. Through Nov. 1. Field of Screams, 3493 Marietta Ave., Lancaster, $12; free, ages 1 and under, 717-285-7748, corncobacres.com.
Corn Maze: 8 miles of trails through a 25-acre maze. 9 a.m.-midnight Fri.-Sat.; 9 a.m.-9 p.m. Sun. Through Nov. 2. Wilcox Farms, 1134 Reading Ave., Boyertown, 19512, $8, www.wilcoxfamilyfarm.com .
Corn Maze and Fun Fall: 14-acre corn maze, hayrides, pumpkin patch, more. 9 a.m.-8 p.m. Sun.-Thurs.; 9 a.m.-10 p.m. Fri.-Sat. Through Nov. 1. Raub's Farm Market, 1459 Tatamy Road, Tatamy, $7; $4, seniors, ages 12 and under. www.raubsfarmmarket.com .
Count's Halloween Spooktacular: Kids can come in costume and walk through mazes, go on hayride with characters, hear live music, trick or treat, more. 10 a.m.-6 p.m. Sat.-Sun. Through Nov. 1. Sesame Place, 100 Sesame Road, Langhorne, $55; $45; $40, 215-752-7070, sesameplace.com.
Fall Farm Festival: Hayrides to the pumpkin patch, corn and hay maze, barrel train, scarecrow making, more. 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Sat.; 11 a.m.-4 p.m. Sun. Through Nov. 1. Hausman's Fruit Farm 2915 Limeport Pike, Coopersburg. hausmansfruitfarm.com.
Fall Fest : Corn maze, hayrides to the pumpkin patch, petting zoo, pony rides. 11 a.m.-6 p.m. Sat.-Sun. Through Oct. 31. Unangst Tree Farm 7317 Bethlehem-Bath Pike, Bath, www.unangst-treefarm.com .
Fall Fun: Trolley and wagon-rides to the pumpkin patch, corn maze, train rides, petting farm, pony rides. 10 a.m.-6 p.m. Sat.-Sun. Through Oct. 31. Apple Blossom Village, 690 Allegheny Road, Mount Bethel Township, $15, ages 12 and under; $12.50, adults, 570-897-9050, appleblossomvillage.com.
Fall Harvest Festival: Pumpkin field, Adventure Farm fun area, hayride, animals, corn maze, pumpkin picking, potato sling shot, Harvest Moon Hayride, flashlight corn maze and campfire (7-10 p.m. Fri.-Sat.; $8). 10 a.m.-6 p.m. Through Nov. 6. Hellerick's Family Farm, 5500 N. Easton Road (Route 611), Plumsteadville, $11.95; $8.95, 215-766-8388, hellericksfarm.com.
Great Pocono Pumpkin Festival: Hayride, 3-D explosion, enchanted woods, treasure dig, magic gardens, pirate ship playground, bounce houses, "Frozen" funhouse, midway rides, games, pony rides, face painting, seasonal crafts and produce. Through Oct. 25. Country Junction, Route 209, Lehighton, $10, 610-377-8447, countryjunction.com.
Grim's Fall Festival and Corn Maze: Find your way through the field of corn, pick your own pumpkin, barnyard animals. Flashlight maze nights (6:30-10 p.m. Fri.-Sat.). Hayride tours (Fri.-Sun.). 10 a.m.-6 p.m. Through Oct. 31. Grim's Greenhouse and Farm Market, 9941 Schantz Road, Breinigsville, $4.95-$15.95, 610-395-5655, grimsgreenhouse.com.
Halloween Train Rides: Kids can come in costume and get a treat before they get to pick a pumpkin. 10 and 11:30 a.m., 1, 2:30, 4 and 5:30 p.m. Oct. 24-25, Oct. 31. Allentown and Auburn Railroad, 232-298 Railroad St, Kutztown, $12; $6, ages 3-11; free, ages 2 and under, 570-778-7531, allentownandauburnrr.com.
Happy Hauntings: Themed rides, special entertainment, tasty treats and Trick-or-Treat Trail. 2-9 p.m. Sat.; 2-8 p.m. Sun., Oct. 17-18, 24-25 and Oct. 31-Nov. 1. Dutch Wonderland, 2249 Route 30 East, Lancaster, $23.99, 717-291-1888, dutchwonderland.com.
Hayrides To The Witches House: Visit the witches house for stories, jokes and a treat, followed by a bonfire with marshmallows to roast and apple cider. 5:30-8 p.m. Mon.-Thurs.; 5:30-8:30 p.m. Fri.-Sat. Through Oct. 30. Linvilla Orchards, 137 W. Knowlton Road, Media, $9, 610-876-7116, linvilla.com.
Hersheypark in the Dark: Rides, live entertainment, trick or treat, visit the creatures of the night at ZooAmerica, more. 5-10 p.m. Oct. 16, 23, 30: noon-10 p.m. Oct. 17, 24, 31; noon-9 p.m. Oct. 18, 25. Hersheypark, 100 W. Hersheypark Drive, Hershey, $24-$59.50, 800-437-7439, hersheypark.com.
Knight Train Corn Maze Trail: Take the train to the maze for picnic lunch (bring your own), visit the Susquehanna Mining Co. (additional fee) and play the corn maze game. 11 a.m, and 12:30, 2, 3:30 p.m. Sat. and 11 a.m, and 12:30, 2 p.m. Sun. Through Oct. 26. Delaware River Railroad Excursions, 100 Elizabeth St., Phillipsburg, $20; $13, children, 908-454-4433, 877trainride.com/cornmaze.
Maize Maze: 5-acre corn maze with over 2.5 miles of paths, scenic bridges, and clues, Barnyard and Courtyard activities, Flashlight Maze (6-10 p.m. Fri.-Sat.). 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Thurs.; 10 a.m.-10 p.m. Fri.-Sat. Through Nov. 7. Cherry Crest Adventure Farm, 150 Cherry Hill Road, Lancaster, $14; $17; $20, 866-546-1799, cherrycrestfarm.com.
Maize Quest: "Knights & Dragons": 10-acre cornfield maze with pathways cut in the shape of a knight and a fire-breathing dragon, rope maze, tile maze, barnyard board games, Noah's Ark Playground plus giant corn maze and mini corn maze. Flashlight nights (Fri.-Sat. through Oct. 24). Pumpkin picking and hayrides (10 a.m.-5 p.m. Sat.-Sun. through Oct. 25). 10 a.m.-5 p.m. daily Through Nov. 15. $12.99; free, ages 2 and under. Stony Hill Gardens, 8 Route 23 (Route 513), Chester, www.stonyhillfarms.com
Mazezilla: 11 acres of winding stalk, hayrides, pumpkin launching, 100-foot slide. 11 a.m-5 p.m. Oct. 12, Nov. 1; 11 a.m.-8 p.m. Oct. 18, 25; 11 a.m.-10 p.m. Oct. 9, 10, 11, 16, 17, 23, 24, 30, 31. Klingel's Farm, Old Route 115, one mile from Saylorsburg/Wind Gap flea market, Saylorsburg, $8; $12, 570-402-7378, mazezilla.com/corn-maze.
Monster Mania: Trick or treat through four floors of frightful fun, compete in the eerie Halloween scavenger hunt, spooky photo-ops, activities. 10 a.m.-6 p.m. Sat.-Sun.; 9 a.m.-4 p.m. Mon.-Fri. Through Oct. 31. Crayola Experience, 30 Centre Square, Easton, $18.99, 610-515-8000, crayolaexperience.com.
Pumpkinland: Live music and entertainment, hayrides, train and pony rides, face painting, straw bale and cornfield mazes, pick-your-own apples, candy and caramel apples, Jack-o'-lantern exhibit and costume-parade (3 p.m. Oct. 25). 8 a.m-8 p.m. Sun.-Thurs.; 8 a.m.-9 p.m. Fri.-Sat. Through Oct. 30. Linvilla Orchards, 137 W. Knowlton Road, Media, free, 610-876-7116, linvilla.com.
Seiple Farms Corn Maze: 18-acre maze ($7; $6, ages 3-11; free, ages 2 and under), hayrides, pick-your-own pumpkins, amusements, haunted barn, farm animals, more. 10 a.m.-6 p.m. Sat.; 11 a.m.-6 p.m. Sun. Through Nov. 1. Seiple Farms, Route 329, Bath, free, 610-837-6282, seiplefarms.com.
Silly Spooky Weekends: Ghostology show, a challenge for visitors to help scare away ghosts that have run wild since the cente's top-secret ghost experiments during the past summer. Tunnel Vision exhibit is transformed into a haunted tunnel and kids can make boo bubbles at Inquiry Island. 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Sat., noon-5 p.m. Oct. 11-Nov. 1; Oct. 12-10 a.m.-5 p.m., Da Vinci Science Center, 3145 Hamilton Blvd. Bypass, Allentown, $12.95, 484-664-1002, davincisciencecenter.org.
Snoopy's Halloween Party: Join the Peanuts characters for pumpkin painting and mask making, petting zoo, Franklin's Monster Mania featuring the Funster House and Monster Foam Machine, Mansion House Hotel and Planet Snoopy theme park. noon-5 p.m. Sat.-Sun. Through Nov. 1. Dorney Park, 3830 Dorney Park Road, South Whitehall Township, $32-$37, 610-395-2000, dorneypark.com.
Spooky Glow Golf: Golf in the fog and laser light-filled cave, under twinkling lights, spooky music. Fireworks (8 p.m. Fri.-Sat.; weather permitting). Dusk. Thurs.-Sun. Through Oct. 31. Spring Hill Miniature Golf, Sand Spring Road, east of Route 309, Schnecksville, $6; $5, children, 610-769-7900, springhillgolfandbattingcages.net.
SPECIAL EVENTS
The Addams Family Musical: Wednesday Addams, the ultimate princess of darkness, has grown up and fallen in love with a sweet, smart young man from a respectable family. 7:30 p.m. Oct. 9,10. 15, 16, 17, 22, 23 and 24; 2 p.m. Oct. 18 and 25. Civic Theatre, 527 N. 19th St., Allentown, $20-$31, 610-432-8943, civictheatre.com.
First Friday Fright Night: "Halloween 4" and "Halloween 5": The Return of Michael Myers and the Revenge of Michael Myers. 9:45 p.m. Oct. 9. The Colonial Theatre, 227 Bridge St., Phoenixville, $10; $8, seniors; $6, children, 610-917-1228, thecolonialtheatre.com.
Sweeney Todd, the Demon Barber of Fleet Street: When the unjustly imprisoned Benjamin Barker returns to London he becomes Sweeney Todd and vows revenge on those who framed him. 7 p.m. Oct. 9-11, 16-18. Washington Crossing Open Air Theatre, Washington Crossing State Park, 355 Washington Crossing-Pennington Road, Titusville, N.J. $15; $12, seniors; $10, ages 12 and under, 267-885-9857. dpacatoat.com.
Scare at St. Mary's Villa: Halloween pavilion walk-through to benefit the Komen foundation. 6-9 p.m. Oct. 10-11, 17-18, 24-24, 31 and Nov. 1. St. Mary's Villa, St. Mary's Villa Road, Elmhurst Township, Scranton, $5, 570-795-2810.
It's the Great Pumpkin in the Park: Trick or treat through the park and meet fairy tale and cartoon characters along the way ending with a visit from the Great Pumpkin himself. noon until 3 p.m. Oct. 10-11, 17-18. Washington Crossing Open Air Theatre, Washington Crossing State Park, 355 Washington Crossing-Pennington Road, Titusville, N.J. $6, children; $4, adults. 267-885-9857. dpacatoat.com.
Trunk or Treat: Kids in costume stroll the grounds and collect treats from visitors with decorated car trunks. 5 p.m. Oct. 10-11. Becky's Drive-In Theatre, Route 248, Berlinsville, free, beckysdi.com.
Historic Haunted Ghost Walk: 8:30 p.m. Oct. 10, Oct. 17, Boyertown Area Historical Society Building, 43 S. Chestnut St., $12; $10, members; reservations at hauntedboyertown@gmail.com . 610-367-0630.
Last Fling Pocono Sling: Pumpkin slinging by catapult and trebuchet teams, Sir Chunks A Lot demonstrations, kids corner, activity tent, vintage car displays, food and craft vendors, entertainment. 9 a.m.-5 p.m. Oct. 10-11. Pocono International Raceway, 1234 Long Pond Road, Long Pond, $4-$16, 570-646-2300, pumpkinsling.com.
Pa. Renaissance Faire: Halloween Daze and Spooky Knights: An All Hallow's Eve Fest includes a visit to Scratchy's Pumpkin Patch, pumpkin decorating, trick-or-treating in the Shire, child and adult costume contests, treasure hunt. 11 a.m.-8 p.m. Oct. 10-11, 17-18, 24-25. Mount Hope Estate & Winery, 2775 Lebanon Road, Manheim, $25.95, adv.; $30.95, gate; $11.95, ages 5-11, 717-665-7021, parenfaire.com.
Pumpkin Patch Train Ride: Children select a pumpkin from the patch and choose a decorating kit to take home. 1, 2, 3, 4 p.m. Oct. 10-11. Kempton Railroad Station, Route 143, $10, 610-756-6469, kemptontrain.com.
Silly Spooky Weekends: Ghostology show, a challenge for visitors to help scare away ghosts that have run wild since the center's top-secret ghost experiments during the past summer. Tunnel Vision exhibit is transformed into a haunted tunnel and kids can make boo bubbles at Inquiry Island. 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Sat., noon-5 p.m. Sun. Oct. 11-Nov. 1; Oct. 12-10 a.m.-5 p.m. Da Vinci Science Center, 3145 Hamilton Blvd. Bypass, Allentown, $12.95, 484-664-1002, davincisciencecenter.org.
Ghost Stories of Crystal Cave: Tales and stories of ghostly encounters and sightings from the past and present by master storyteller Charles J. Adams III. Book singing follows. 1 p.m. Oct. 11. Crystal Cave, 963 Crystal Cave Road, Kutztown, $20, includes tour of cave, 610-683-6765.
View & Brew Movie: Young Frankenstein: The grandson of Victor Frankenstein is a teaching surgeon who has spent his life living down the legend of his grandfather, even changing the pronunciation of his name. When the diary of his grandfather is brought to him, he takes a leave of absence to examine the family castle. Due to a switch, he implants an abnormal brain in his creation which causes problems, but things really get out of hand when the young Frankenstein's bride to be shows up at the castle. 7:30 p.m. Oct. 12. Sellersville Theater, 24 W. Temple Ave., free, 215-257-5808, st94.com.
